controllers.odl_beryllium_pb package¶

Submodules¶

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.change_persistence module¶

Handler disabling the percistence mode in the configuration of the controller.

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.change_persistence.change_persistence()[source]¶

Change the persistence attribute to false. The controller will not backup datastore on the disk.

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.change_stats_period module¶

Handler changing the rate of statistics collection from the topology switches

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.change_stats_period.change_stats_period()[source]¶
Takes as command line argument the new interval of statistics period we want to set in the configuration file of the controller and writes it
in this file.

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.flowmods_configure module¶

This handler configures the controller to respond with mac-to-mac FlowMods to PacketINs with ARP payload messages. It also configures the idle and hard timeout of these FlowMods to have the minimum value.

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.flowmods_configure.change_flow_timeouts()[source]¶

Set the minimum idle and hard flow timeouts in the controller’s configuration file.

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.flowmods_configure.change_proactive_flow_mod()[source]¶

Unset proactive flow mod, in controller’s configuration.

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.get_flows module¶

This handler returns the number of installed flows of a topology, connected to the controller. This information is extracted from controller’s operational datastore, using RESTCONF.

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.get_flows.get_flow_stats(ip, port, username, password)[source]¶

Collects and returns data about installed flows for the topology nodes

Parameters:
  • ip (str) – controller IP Address
  • port (int) – controller restconf port number
  • username (str) – username for restconf authorization
  • password (str) – password for restconf authorization
Returns:

the number of installed flows in the topology nodes or a negative number in a negative case
Return type:

int
controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.get_flows.get_oper_flows()[source]¶

Query number of flows registered in ODL operational DS

Returns:number of flows found, 0 if none exists and -1 in case of error.
Return type:int

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.xml_utils module¶

controllers.odl_beryllium_pb.xml_utils.manipulate_xml(input_filename, output_filename, string_to_find, target_value)[source]¶

It gets a configuration (.xml in our case) file, defined by the input_filename parameter and changes its contents defied by the string_to_find parameter. The new values are defined in the target_value parameter. The result is saved in a new file defined by the output_file.

Parameters:
  • input_filename (str) – The configuration filepath we want to change.
  • output_filename (str) – The new configuration file, after changing the original one.
  • string_to_find (str) – The string we want to change in the configuration file.
  • target_value (str) – The new value to replace the string_to_find
